newsitem.title: INDIA: IFC for transparency to boost India infrastructure.
newsitem.headline: IFC for transparency to boost India infrastructure.

text.p: A strong political commitment and a transparent regime were critical for the development of India's infrastructure industry, an official of the International Finance Corporation (IFC) said on Wednesday.
"The political risk (in India) is high," Gilbert Marrou, engineering advisor at IFC's New Delhi office told an infrastructure seminar.
"There is need for clear, strong political commitment and transparency," Marrou said without elaborating.
He advised India to proceed quickly with small projects such as bridges, road bypasses and expansion of existing ports. Success in these would have a "demonstration effect," he said.
He said private participation was a must to fulfil India's huge infrastructure requirements. "But there is still room for government," he said.
"There is plenty of money available and a lack of good projects," he said. "Start with good projects, there would be good money," he said.
